data.taskTitle: complete but active sessions show signal /jat:start commands for new sessions
Fix cross-session signal pollution in EventStack
summary: Identified race condition: UserPromptSubmit hook fires BEFORE /jat:start updates agent file
Fixed user-prompt-signal.sh to skip /jat:start commands entirely
The /jat:start skill emits its own starting signal which is the proper event for new sessions
reviewFocus: Verify regex ^/jat:start correctly matches all /jat:start variants
Confirm starting signal from /jat:start skill is sufficient for timeline visibility

summary: Diagnosed race condition: UserPromptSubmit hook fires BEFORE /jat:start updates agent file
Verified fix in user-prompt-signal.sh that skips /jat:start commands
Fix prevents events from being written to old sessions timeline during agent transition

suggestedTasks.title: Clean up stale timeline events from old sessions
suggestedTasks.description: FaintGrove and other completed sessions have /jat:start events from other sessions that were written before the fix. Could add a cleanup script or just leave them as historical artifacts.
suggestedTasks.reason: Historical pollution before fix was applied

patterns: UserPromptSubmit hooks fire BEFORE the command runs
For commands that change session identity (/jat:start), skip the hook entirely
gotchas: Race condition: hook reads agent file before /jat:start updates it
Solution: skip writing events for commands that will emit their own signals
